com.persistit.logging
Class DefaultPersistitLogger

java.lang.Object
  com.persistit.logging.DefaultPersistitLogger
All Implemented Interfaces:
PersistitLogger
public class DefaultPersistitLogger
extends Object
implements PersistitLogger

The default implementation of logging for Persistit. Writes log messages to a file and/or System.err. Many applications will uses one of the logging adapter classes instead of this class to connect Persistit's log output to an existing infrastructure.

Version:
1.0
See Also:
ApacheCommonsLogAdapter, JDK14LoggingAdapter, Log4JAdapter, Slf4jAdapter

DefaultPersistitLogger

public DefaultPersistitLogger(String fileName)
Construct a logger that logs messages to a file. If the supplied path name is null then log only WARNING and higher messages to the system console.

Parameters:

isLoggable

public boolean isLoggable(PersistitLevel level)
Description copied from interface: PersistitLogger
Test whether a message at the specified level should be written to the log. This method is called during configuration, not once per log message.

Specified by:

Parameters:

Returns:

flush

public void flush()
Writes pending I/O to the log file. Because this implementation uses a BufferedWriter, log messages may be held in memory rather than being written to disk. Since the most interesting log messages in the event of a failure are often the last messages, it is helpful for these messages to be flushed to disk on a regular basis. This method is invoked at various times within the execution of Persistit to increase the likelihood that the log file will be useful in case the application exits abruptly.

Specified by:
flush in interface PersistitLogger
